title: Column - Production Examples & Patterns
description: Comprehensive real-world examples for column widths, responsive behavior, alignment, and sticky columns

examples.name: Equal 3-Column Layout (33.33% each)
examples.description: Standard 3-column grid where each column takes 33.33% width on desktop, stacks on mobile
examples.visualDescription: Three equal-width columns side by side on desktop (33.33% each). On tablet (sm), columns become 50% wide (2 columns, then 1). On mobile (xs), all columns stack to 100% width. 20px padding inside each column.
examples.useCase: Feature sections, service listings, team grids, product showcases
examples.responsiveNotes: Classic 3→2→1 column pattern. Parent tp-row should have columns: 3 and appropriate gutterSpace.
examples.layoutNotes: blockSpace adds bottom margin between blocks inside column. Combined with row gutterSpace, creates consistent grid spacing.
examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with columns: 3, sectionWidth: 'boxed'

examples.name: 2-Column Main + Sidebar (70% + 30%)
examples.description: Asymmetric 2-column layout with wide main content area and narrow sidebar
examples.visualDescription: Main content column at 70% width, sidebar at 30% on desktop. On tablet (sm), both become 100% and stack. Main content column has white background, sidebar has light gray (#f8f9fa).
examples.useCase: Blog layouts, documentation pages, article layouts with sidebar widgets
examples.responsiveNotes: Sidebar stacks below main content on tablet/mobile. Use colOrder to reorder if needed.
examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with columns: 2, columnPosition: 'space-between'

examples.name: 4-Column Product Grid (25% each)
examples.description: Four equal columns for product/portfolio grid that adapts to 2 columns on tablet, 1 on mobile
examples.visualDescription: 4 equal columns at 25% width each on desktop. Each column has white background, subtle border, and hover shadow effect. On tablet: 50% (2 columns). On mobile: 100% (stacked).
examples.useCase: Product grids, portfolio items, image galleries, team member cards
examples.responsiveNotes: Classic 4→2→1 pattern. Hover shadow creates interactive card feel.
examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with columns: 4, gutterSpace: {md: '20', unit: 'px'}

examples.name: Sticky Sidebar Column (Pro)
examples.description: Sidebar column that sticks to viewport while scrolling on desktop, normal on mobile
examples.visualDescription: 30% width sidebar column on desktop that becomes sticky when scrolling past 100px from top. Stays sticky until bottom spacing (40px) is reached. Light gray background, subtle shadow. Normal behavior on tablet/mobile.
examples.useCase: Sticky sidebars, fixed navigation menus, persistent sidebar widgets, table of contents
examples.responsiveNotes: Sticky only on desktop (stickyDes: true). Normal scroll on tablet/mobile for better UX.
warnings: stickycol: true required to enable sticky behavior
topSpace: distance from viewport top before column becomes sticky (px)
botSpace: distance from viewport bottom to stop sticky (px)
Set zIndex high enough to appear above content (recommended 10-999)
Sticky disabled on tablet/mobile by default (stickyTab: false, stickyMob: false)
Test sticky behavior with varying content heights
Sidebar content should not exceed viewport height or it won't sticky properly

validationRules.stickycol: Must be true to enable sticky
validationRules.zIndex: Should be set to avoid z-index conflicts

examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with columns: 2, columnPosition: 'space-between'

examples.name: Column with Centered Content
examples.description: Column with content vertically and horizontally centered, perfect for hero sections or CTAs
examples.visualDescription: 50% width column with all content centered both vertically and horizontally. Purple gradient background, white text, rounded corners. Minimum height ensures vertical centering works.
examples.useCase: Hero sections, call-to-action areas, centered feature highlights, promotional content
examples.visualTips: verticalPosition: 'center' + horizontalPosition: 'center' creates perfect centering. Parent row should have adequate minHeight for vertical centering to be visible.
examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with minHeight: {md: '400', unit: 'px'}

examples.name: Reordered Column (Mobile First)
examples.description: Column that appears in different positions on mobile vs desktop using flex order
examples.visualDescription: On desktop: appears as 3rd column (order: 3). On tablet: appears as 2nd column (order: 2). On mobile: appears first (order: 1). Useful for prioritizing content on mobile.
examples.useCase: Mobile-first designs, reordering content priority, feature highlighting, responsive content strategy
examples.responsiveNotes: Uses CSS flexbox order property. Lower numbers appear first. All sibling columns should have colOrder set for predictable behavior.
warnings: colOrder uses flexbox order property - values are relative to siblings
If only one column has order, others default to order: 0
For predictable results, set colOrder on all columns in row
Negative values allowed (e.g., '-1' appears before '0')
Order values can be any integer (string format)
commonPatterns: Desktop: Sidebar (order 1) + Main (order 2) → Mobile: Main (order 1) + Sidebar (order 2)
Desktop: Image (order 1) + Text (order 2) → Mobile: Text (order 1) + Image (order 2)
Prioritize important content first on mobile regardless of desktop layout
examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with multiple columns

examples.name: Column with Custom Border & Shadow
examples.description: Styled column with solid border and shadow effects for card-like appearance
examples.visualDescription: Column styled as elevated card: white background, 2px purple border, rounded corners (8px), medium shadow. On hover: border color changes, shadow increases. Perfect for clickable cards or feature boxes.
examples.useCase: Feature cards, product cards, team member cards, clickable content boxes
examples.visualTips: Combining border, shadow, and hover states creates interactive card effect. Border color transition + shadow increase signals interactivity.
examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with columns: 3, gutterSpace: {md: '20'}

examples.name: Full-Width Column (100%)
examples.description: Single full-width column spanning entire row width, used for full-width content sections
examples.visualDescription: 100% width column on all breakpoints. Light gray background, generous padding. Content blocks inside have 30px bottom margin for spacing.
examples.useCase: Full-width hero content, full-width text sections, single-column layouts, centered content areas
examples.responsiveNotes: Padding scales down on smaller screens for better mobile UX.
examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with columns: 1 or no columns attribute

examples.name: Narrow Centered Column (50%)
examples.description: Centered column at 50% width for focused content presentation
examples.visualDescription: 50% width column centered in row on desktop. Full width on mobile. White background, shadow, rounded corners. Perfect for centered forms, CTAs, or narrow content.
examples.useCase: Centered forms, newsletter signups, narrow content, focused CTAs, login pages
examples.visualTips: Margin: {left: 'auto', right: 'auto'} centers column when width < 100%. Parent row should have sufficient width.
examples.parentRow: Use in tp-row with columns: 1, sectionWidth: 'boxed'

examples.name: Column with Top/Left Alignment
examples.description: Column with content aligned to top-left (default flexbox start positions)
examples.visualDescription: 33.33% width column with content aligned to top (vertically) and left (horizontally). White background, subtle border. Natural left-aligned layout for text-heavy content.
examples.useCase: Text content, blog posts, articles, list items, standard content flow
examples.alignmentNotes: flex-start = top/left alignment. Use 'center' for centered, 'flex-end' for bottom/right, 'space-between' for justified.

centered-narrow.description: Centered 50% column → full width on mobile

block_id.description: 4-character hex ID, never modify after creation

Width.description: Column width as percentage. md + sm + xs values for responsive behavior.

verticalPosition.description: Vertical alignment of content inside column (flexbox align-items)

horizontalPosition.description: Horizontal alignment of content inside column (flexbox justify-content)

blockSpace.description: Bottom margin between child blocks inside column

topSpace.description: Top offset in pixels before column becomes sticky (e.g., '100')

botSpace.description: Bottom spacing in pixels where sticky stops (e.g., '40')

stickyDes/stickyTab/stickyMob.description: Enable sticky behavior on specific devices (desktop/tablet/mobile)

colOrder.description: CSS flexbox order for reordering columns. Lower values appear first. Can be negative.

Margin.description: External spacing outside column. Use {left: 'auto', right: 'auto'} to center column.

warnings: **CRITICAL**: Never modify or regenerate block_id - causes blocks to break
Column must be inside tp-row parent block
Width percentages in row should total ~100% (accounting for gutterSpace)
Parent row's gutterSpace becomes padding on columns - plan total spacing accordingly
Sticky columns (stickycol: true) require Pro version
Sticky columns need sufficient height difference between column and viewport to work
colOrder affects visual order, not DOM order (impacts accessibility)
verticalPosition/horizontalPosition work with flexbox - ensure content wraps properly
blockSpace adds margin between child blocks - can accumulate with other spacing
openBg: 1 required before setting background properties
openBorder: 1 required before setting border properties
openShadow: 1 required before setting shadow properties
Margin auto (left/right) only centers when column width < 100%

commonMistakes.fix: Ensure all column widths + gutterSpace don't exceed 100%
commonMistakes.impact: Columns wrap or overflow, breaking layout

commonMistakes.fix: Always set topSpace (e.g., '100') and botSpace (e.g., '40') for sticky columns
commonMistakes.impact: Sticky behavior may not work as expected

commonMistakes.fix: Always set md, sm, xs width values for proper responsive behavior
commonMistakes.impact: Column doesn't adapt to mobile, poor UX

commonMistakes.mistake: Using colOrder on one column but not siblings
commonMistakes.fix: If using colOrder, set it on all columns in row for predictable results
Always set openBg: 1 before bgType, bgDefaultColor, etc.

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting verticalPosition to work without row minHeight
commonMistakes.fix: Parent row needs minHeight for vertical alignment to be visible

commonMistakes.mistake: Sticky column content exceeding viewport height
commonMistakes.fix: Keep sticky column content shorter than viewport height
commonMistakes.impact: Sticky behavior fails or content gets cut off

commonMistakes.mistake: Not testing column stacking on mobile
commonMistakes.fix: Always test xs breakpoint on actual mobile devices
commonMistakes.impact: Layout breaks or has poor spacing on mobile

bestPractices: Always provide responsive Width values (md, sm, xs)
Stack columns to 100% width on mobile (xs: 100) unless specifically needed
Scale down Padding on mobile to maximize content space
Use blockSpace consistently (15-30px) for visual rhythm
Sticky columns work best for sidebars 30% width or less
Use colOrder sparingly - can hurt accessibility if overused
Combine verticalPosition + horizontalPosition for perfect centering
Use Margin auto (left/right) to center narrower columns
Test hover states (HoverBg, HoverBorder, HoverBShadow) for interactive columns
Keep sticky column content concise - under viewport height
Use semantic widths: 70/30 for main+sidebar, 50/50 for equal split

layoutContext.widthBehavior: Width is percentage of parent row width. Includes padding from row's gutterSpace.
layoutContext.gutterInteraction: Parent row's gutterSpace becomes padding on column wrapper. Column's Padding is additional internal spacing.
layoutContext.stickyBehavior: Sticky columns use position: sticky. Requires topSpace offset and sufficient scrollable height.
layoutContext.orderBehavior: colOrder uses CSS flexbox order. Lower numbers appear first. Default is 0.
layoutContext.alignmentBehavior: verticalPosition/horizontalPosition use flexbox. Column inner uses flex container for child blocks.

performanceConsiderations: Sticky columns use position: sticky - modern CSS, performant
Avoid excessive shadows on many columns - can impact paint performance
Gradients in column backgrounds are GPU-accelerated, minimal impact
Test mobile performance with stacked columns - many tall columns can cause scroll lag

responsiveStrategy.cascadeBehavior: Width values cascade: md → sm → xs. If sm not set, uses md. If xs not set, uses sm or md.
mobileConsiderations: Stack to 100% width on mobile unless specific need
Reduce blockSpace on mobile for tighter spacing
Use colOrder to prioritize important content first on mobile
Disable sticky on mobile (stickyMob: false) for better UX
Test touch targets - ensure sufficient spacing between clickable elements

semanticConsiderations: colOrder changes visual order, not DOM/reading order - screen readers follow DOM
If using colOrder for mobile-first content, ensure DOM order also makes semantic sense
Don't rely solely on visual alignment - ensure logical content flow in HTML
colorContrast: Ensure text over column backgrounds meets WCAG AA (4.5:1 normal, 3:1 large)
Test border colors for sufficient contrast with background
Gradient backgrounds should maintain contrast at all points
